images.caption: Figure 1:Map of the 116 language varieties represented in Global PIQA, colored according to top-level language families from Glottolog(Hammarström et al.,,2023). All languages and language families are listed in §B.

Figure 2:The format of Global PIQA examples. Each example can be used either in a completion setting (to evaluate pretrained-only models) or a prompted setting (to evaluate instruction-tuned models). Evaluation method details are in §5.

Figure 3:Accuracy averaged across all languages vs. parameter count for open-weight models. We display names of top-performing models. Shape indicates model family, and color indicates openness (open-weight in purple vs. fully open in pink, including open data). All other models are plotted as gray dots. Chance performance (50%) and performance for Gemini 2.5 Pro and Gemini 2.5 Flash-Lite are plotted as dashed lines.
